Description: Steatite(?) shabti with a curled lappet-wig, a modelled face and hands in low relief at thigh-level holding the djed and tet-symbols; the chest is covered by a representation of a Ba-bird with a protruding head and incised outstretched wings; the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of the Book of The Dead in seven rows of incised Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with incised representations of two hoes and a seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
